body: Heres's where/why it was added: https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/issues/7515

> why it doesn't work the same with the all() method - it would be nice

Yeah. I think so.
Yes, I think it's a good plan.

Soooo... should I make a PR with this code? Because as I said - I'm really not sure if it doesn't break anything else. 
I (maybe naively) thought you would see it's a save update.
Yes. Do it. PRs are in continuous integration, it will run framework test set so we'll know if it breaks something covered by one of the tests at least.
AR is a complex part of the framework so it's hard to be sure nothing is broken.

issue.title: Fixex #18499 - Query::$indexBy is auto-inserted into Query::$select in Query::all()

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
When using `yii\db\Query::all()`, the `yii\db\Query::$indexBy` is auto inserted into `yii\db\Query::$select` - The same as in `yii\db\Query::column()`

If it works, there should be probably made some changes in docs in `Query::$indexBy`, `Query::all()` and original `Query::column()`. 

| Q             | A
| ------------- | ---
| Is bugfix?    | ❌
| New feature?  | ✔️
| Breaks BC?    | ❌
| Tests pass?   | sorry, dunno
| Fixed issues  | #18499

body:
Well, I tried my best. I did some another changes based on the current state of `Query::column()`.
It worked on my different test examples - nothing in select, duplicities in select, custom alias, etc. It worked.
As I'm writing in the PR, it this PR is accepted, we should probably add some info into docs.
It didn't broke any existing tests. That's great. A test for new behavior would be really great. And docs, of course.

I could make a PR for changes in the docs, but my English isn't really sufficient. Someone would have to correct my typos. So is it desirable? Should I do it? 
About the test ... ups - I can't write them :( Sorry. One of my skeleton in a closet.

> Someone would have to correct my typos

I will do it. Way easier to correct typos than writing docs from scratch.

I tried to write some docs. I wasn't sure about the PHPDoc. Info about indexBy() is scattered across three methods.
My commit is linked via the message, but what should I do to "connect" it properly to this issue? Should I do another PR? Or is it enough to commit to my original branch as I just did?
Or should I have create a completely new branch and PR? I din't find it in the guide - https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/master/docs/internals/git-workflow.md

Ideally, a new branch and PR are preferred. Alternatively, you can PR from your fork's master. The drawback in this case is that you won't be able to do more than a single pull requset from the master branch.
https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/master/docs/internals/git-workflow.md#3-create-a-new-branch-for-your-feature-based-on-the-current-yii-master-branch

Ok, I prepared a second branch (call it branch B) created from the original branch (call it branch A). The B brach contains every changes made in branch A.
If I create a PR v from branch B, part of it will be redundant with the first PR, wont it?

Another strange thing to me - if I look here on my original PR https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/pull/18513/commits , the new commit with the docs draft is part od the original PR. I suppose it's because the PR is updated based on my A branch. Isn't that a better way? Because the docs aren't new issue, it's part of the original one.

So what should I do now? PR from my branch B https://github.com/OndrejVasicek/yii2/tree/18499-docs-draft ?
Or is that updated PR enough?

I'm really sorry occupying your time witch such basic stuff.
The PR is a branch. Push more commit to it and these will end up in the PR. One PR (if that's up to date) is enough.

That makes sense this way. Very handy. 
Then this commit https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/pull/18513/commits/e654dedbb4f1d1d1b84d2bd04830bf2ec4d7a226 adds the docs draft. Can you check it if it's ok and fix typos?
Alright. How about some unit tests meanwhile? It should not be that bad to check how to do it ;)

I'm planning to learn the whole workflow properly, begin on one of my projects, but it’s no way a matter of following weeks ☹
I’m afraid I can’t help here further. Will do my best making my next contribution being more useful.
It is useful, don't worry. Just a bit harder to verify and make sure it's not broken in the future.
